definition: lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men

sentences.english: “We close the front door, and they go through the back door,” he says.
sentences.chinese: Tith說，“我們把前門關了，他們還會走後門。”

sentences.english: The route of removal of the deceased should be through the back of the House to avoid any public attention.
sentences.chinese: 在運離屍體的過程中應走後門，避免引起公衆的注意。

sentences.english: He used his influential relatives to help him get in by the back door.
sentences.chinese: 他利用有勢力的親戚以走後門的手段幫他弄到職位。

sentences.english: There's a back door. They'll know you warned me.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有後門，走後門，他們就知道你警告我。

sentences.english: He used his friends to help him get into the civil service by the back door.
sentences.chinese: 他利用朋友幫忙走後門找到了在市政服務機構的工作。

sentences.english: I didn't pull any strings. You were admitted in your own right.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有走後門，你是憑自己的實力被錄用的。

sentences.english: She used her connections to land a job.
sentences.chinese: 她託關係走後門才找到了一份工作。

sentences.english: Want to use the back door?
In order to find a suitable job, I have to pull some strings.
sentences.chinese: 爲了找一份合適的工作，我得走走後門。

sentences.english: There were stores for disabled people where usually traded abled ones.
sentences.chinese: 經常有正常人走後門到殘疾人商店裏買東西。

sentences.english: She has powerful friends, so she got into the diplomatic service by the back door.
sentences.chinese: 她結交了有權有勢的朋友，走後門進了外交部門。

sentences.english: Using the time-honored Chinese method of backdoor connections, Miss Ma was able to get a temporary card in January.
sentences.chinese: 通過走後門，她一月份領到一張臨時身份證。

definition: abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
to play deaf-mute
complete nonsense (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
intermediary/mediator
to become a mere formality
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
equestrianism/horsemanship
idle gossip
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
